metadata.title: CVE-2020-6808 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: When a JavaScript URL (javascript:) is evaluated and the result is astring, this string is parsed to create an HTML document, which is thenpresented. Previously, this document's URL (as reported by thedocument.location property, for example) was the originating javascript:URL which could lead to spoofing attacks; it is now correctly the URL ofthe originating document. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 74.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
